Subject: Suggested Patch upgradation
Description:
Hello team,

we have received mail from Mr. Ioan-Paul Marcu,stating that 

"On June 27, 2024, Netwrix notified you of the publication of the security advisory ADV-2024-002 â€“ Remote Code Execution Vulnerabilities in CoSoSys Endpoint Protector and CoSoSys Unify, and is notifying you of an important update to this advisory. 
A revised hotfix for the CoSoSys Endpoint Protector server has been released and all CoSoSys Endpoint Protector users, including those who applied the original hotfix, are advised to apply this hotfix to their server. 
Access to the security advisory requires a Netwrix Customer Portal user account. If you do not already have one, you may register an account on the Netwrix website. 
Should you have questions or require assistance, please contact Netwrix technical support by opening a case in the customer portal or by phone at +1 (888) 638-9749. Additional regional phone numbers are listed on the Netwrix technical support website." 
 As advised, we checked the Netwrix website but were unable to locate a fix.
Please let us know how to go about repairing this and let us know if it will have an impact on the server. Could you please confirm that a reboot and downtime are required for this activity?
Solution_Comment__c: The vulnerabilities issue got fixed meanwhile
